title: Citi Presents Forum on Cybersecurity in Latin America in Partnership with NAP del Caribe and AMCHAMDR's IT Committee
summary: According to André Salgado, Head of Information Security at Citi, cybercrime cost the region more than $90 million in 2016
tag-1: Citi Presents Forum on Cybersecurity in Latin America in Partnership with NAP del Caribe and AMCHAMDR's IT Committee
tag-2: According to André Salgado, Head of Information Security at Citi, cybercrime cost the region more than $90 million in 2016
tag-3: Santo Domingo – Citi Dominican Republic, in collaboration with NAP del Caribe and the Information Technology Committee of the American Chamber of Commerce of the Dominican Republic (AMCHAMDR), held an event to address the issue of cybersecurity in the region. The centerpiece was a talk on "Key Cybersecurity Threats and Opportunities in Latin America" by André Salgado, Citi's Head of Information Security for Latin America.
tag-4: A main theme of Salgado's talk was the rise in disloyal practices online, including intellectual property theft and illicit earnings that constitute a major threat to the current financial system. Salgado emphasized the importance of prevention in making companies less attractive to cyber attacks, which take only minutes to perpetrate but up to seven months to be detected and can affect an institution's client portfolio, reputation and financial stability.
tag-5: The opening comments were delivered by Maria Waleska Alvarez, President of NAP del Caribe and Amcham DR's IT Committee. She cited a report published in 2016 by the Organization of American States (OAS) and Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) that found that four out of five Latin American countries have no cybersecurity strategies or real plans to protect their technological infrastructure, and the overwhelming majority of attorney generals and judiciaries lack the capacity to prosecute IT crimes.
tag-6: According to Waleska Alvarez, cyber attacks cost Latin America an estimated $90 million last year, a figure that takes into account only those incidents actually reported and represents four times the amount of funding for scientific research in the region.
tag-7: The presenters agreed that the main task facing governments in the region is to create effective laws and regulations to guard against and categorize electronic crime of all types, and train police agents to combat such offenses. "Cybercrime doesn't stop at the border. Governments need to share smart information about threats and forge agreements for broader enforcement of laws targeting electronic crime," Salgado said during his presentation.
tag-8: The information sharing should include research into environmental threats, effective collaboration, conversations about cybersecurity strategy at the government level and timely legislation, Salgado added.
tag-9: Citi Country Officer for the Dominican Republic Máximo Vidal described the safety of client information as an essential part of the bank's mission. "The issue of cybersecurity is one of the top risks to the financial system, the private sector and the public in general. Therefore, it is fundamental for us to play a role in supporting efforts to promote a more stable, secure and productive cyber platform that will benefit our economies and social sustainability."
tag-11: Andre Salgado is the leader of Citi's Information Security team in Latin America, supervising more than 70 employees who specialize in business information, technology, responsibility and asset protection. He is responsible for keeping the office constantly up to date with trends in the information security and running a professional and independent organization capable of providing high-value cybersecurity advice to Citi's commercial partners.
tag-12: Salgado has held his current position since July 2013. He has been with Citi for 12 years, most recently as Head of Information Security for Brazil and South America, where he coordinated the rollout of Citi's information security program in the region and personally supervised individual countries' information security offices.
tag-13: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
